Recuse.origin: [Anglo-French recuser to refuse, from Middle French, from Latin recusare , from re- back + causari to give a reason, from causa cause, reason]

re·cus·ing.definition: [Anglo-Frenchto refuse, from Middle French, from Latin, fromback +to give a reason, fromcause, reason]

1.definition: to challenge or object to (as a judge) as having prejudice or a conflict of interest

2.definition: to disqualify (as oneself or another judge or official) for a proceeding by a judicial act because of prejudice or conflict of interest [an orderthe district attorney from any proceeding may be appealed by the district attorney or the Attorney General ""]
2.recusing: the district attorney from any proceeding may be appealed by the district attorney or the Attorney General "
